t: Rejoice*pn not, O Israel! Exult*ld not like the peoples; for*ln you have played the whore, forsaking your God. You*ld have loved a prostitute’s wages on*ld all threshing floors.
Threshing*ln floor and wine vat shall not feed them, and*ld the new wine shall fail them.
They*ln shall not remain in the land of the Lord,*s but*ld Ephraim shall return to Egypt, and*ld they shall eat unclean food in Assyria.

They*pn shall not pour drink offerings of wine to the Lord,*s and*ld their sacrifices shall not please him. It*ln shall be like mourners’ bread to them; all*ld who eat of it shall be defiled; for*ln their bread shall be for their hunger only; it*ld shall not come to the house of the Lord.*s
What*pn will you do on the day of the appointed festival, and*ld on the day of the feast of the Lord?*s

For*ln behold, they are going away from destruction; but*ld Egypt shall gather them; Memphis*ld shall bury them. Nettles*ln shall possess their precious things of silver; thorns*ld shall be in their tents.

The*pn days of punishment have come; the*ld days of recompense have come; Israel*ld shall know it. The*ln prophet is a fool; the*ld man of the spirit is mad, because*ln of your great iniquity and*ld great hatred.
The*ln prophet is the watchman of Ephraim with my God; yet*ln a fowler’s snare is on all his ways, and*ld hatred in the house of his God.
They*ln have deeply corrupted themselves as*ld in the days of Gibeah: he*ln will remember their iniquity; he*ld will punish their sins.

Like*pn grapes in the wilderness, I*ld found Israel. Like*ln the first fruit on the fig tree in*ld its first season, I*ld saw your fathers. But*ln they came to Baal-peor and*ld consecrated themselves to the thing of shame, and*ld became detestable like the thing they loved.
Ephraim’s*ln glory shall fly away like a bird— no*ld birth, no pregnancy, no conception!
Even*ln if they bring up children, I*ld will bereave them till none is left. Woe*ln to them when*ld I depart from them!
Ephraim,*ln as I have seen, was like a young palm planted in a meadow; but*ld Ephraim must lead his children out to slaughter.
Give*ln them, O Lord—*s what*ld will you give? Give*ln them a miscarrying womb and*ld dry breasts.

Every*pn evil of theirs is in Gilgal; there*ld I began to hate them. Because*ln of the wickedness of their deeds I*ld will drive them out of my house. I*ln will love them no more; all*ld their princes are rebels.
Ephraim*pn is stricken; their*ld root is dried up; they*ld shall bear no fruit. Even*ln though they give birth, I*ld will put their beloved children to death.
My*ln God will reject them because*ld they have not listened to him; they*ld shall be wanderers among the nations.
